jgame.controller

Class MouseLocationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • jgame.controller.AbstractLocRotController
      • jgame.controller.MouseLocationController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller

    public class MouseLocationController
extends AbstractLocRotController
    A simple controller that causes the object to follow the mouse.
    Author:
    William Chargin

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean limitToBounds
      Whether the control should be limited to the bounds of the container.

      • MouseLocationController

        public MouseLocationController(boolean rotateToFollow,
                               int rotationOffset)
        Creates the controller with the specified rotation settings.
        Parameters:
        rotateToFollow - whether the controller should rotate the object to follow the path
        rotationOffset - the rotation offset (default is 0)

    • Method Detail

      • calculateControl

        protected java.awt.geom.Point2D calculateControl(GObject target,
                                                 Context context)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLocRotController
        Calculates the required control the given object with the given context. This method will only be invoked after an immediately preceding call to AbstractLocRotController.canControl(GObject, Context) with the same parameters, and only if said method call returns true.
        Specified by:
        calculateControl in class AbstractLocRotController
        Parameters:
        target - the object to control
        context - the context
        Returns:
        a point representing the displacement as a result of the transform in the form new Point(dx, dy), where dx is the displacement in the positive x direction and dy is the displacement in the positive y direction

      • canControl

        protected boolean canControl(GObject target,
                             Context context)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLocRotController
        Determines whether the given target can be controlled in the given context.
        Specified by:
        canControl in class AbstractLocRotController
        Parameters:
        target - the target
        context - the context
        Returns:
        true if the target can be controlled, or false if it cannot

      • isLimitToBounds

        public boolean isLimitToBounds()
        Determines whether the control is limited to the bounds of the container.
        Returns:
        true if it is limited, or false if it is not

      • setLimitToBounds

        public void setLimitToBounds(boolean limitToBounds)
        Sets whether the control is limited to the bounds of the container.
        Parameters:
        limitToBounds - true if it should be limited, or false if it should not
